page.title: 03THE MENDIP PLATEAU
page.content: The Mendip Plateau averages 250m above sea level. The soil is slightly acidic very stony and variable in depth. this presents problems for farmers in some places. The rock is{permeable {limestone}so the water sinks in through swallets, down joints and, bedding planes to form caves. The main {natural vegetation}is bracken, hawthorn,hazel,yew and ash scrubland interspersed with grass. Land use is not consistant. Sheep,beef cattle, dairy cattle and arable farming all occur,the farmers choice of enterprise being much influenced by economic factors such as the availability of a quota for dairying and EEC guaranted prices for arable crops. Fields are usually large and divided by limestone walls.Winter snow and exposure to wind are the chief climate enemies of the farmer.
